creator: lizas@corrigent.com
text:
Being running from terminal window without DISPLAY environmental variable 
defned properly,
(that is when DISPLAY points to "closed" display, for example), catalina 
(version 4.0.1) sometimes
gets stuck or even crashes. In both cases there is the following line in 
catalina's output: 

X connection to <hostanme>:0.0 broken (explicit kill or server shutdown).

Can anybody explain me, why catalina's processes need DISPLAY variable to be 
properly defined ?

Thanks

If you run it in an XTerm, maybe. This is a user question, please post it in 
tomcat-user.
creator: remm@apache.org

text: The problem is still exist and it is very critical for us to solve it ASAP
creator: lizas@corrigent.com
remm@apache.org
text:
As I said, this seems like a user question and not a bug. I'll leave the bug
open since I have the impression you would reopen it anyway.

The JDK will attempt to contact the X-Server if Fonts or other AWT Windowing
resources are requested.  Server code that attempts to use AWT to manipulate
images will often trigger this.  What version of the JDK are you using?
and what version of Solaris?

Cheers,
-bob
creator: bob@jadn.com
vicentesalvador@netscape.net
text:
You can use JDK 1.4 and patch srun.sh to include parameter -Djava.awt.headless=true
This allows Java to run headless and Tomcat 4 works fine with this without an X
environment.

If you agree you can close this bug as there are a JDK feature that solves this
problem!!!

creator: bob@jadn.com
text:
The DISPLAY environment variable is an artifact of the JDK implemententation
and is not a Tomcat issue.
